STEP 2: Find the knitting gauge given to you in the pattern and enter the details.
Example 1: knitting across rows"
If the pattern gauge is \"10 sts/15 rows = 4 inches\", then you enter:
Example 2: knitting in the round
If the pattern gauge is \"22 rows of 22 stitches in the round = 2 inches\", then you enter:
STEP 3: Capture your own knitting gauge by making a 10 stitch by 10 row stockinette sample and measuring it
Don\'t round the measurement up or down too much.
Example: accurate measuring
STEP 4: Click \'Save\' and your gauges are captured and stored for you to use over and over again until you\'re done knitting the project.
Use the calculator:
STEP 1: Name your project and choose a picture for it (picture is optional)
Hint: The easiest way might be to take a screenshot of your pattern
STEP 1: Use the pull-down menu to choose the project you\'re knitting
STEP 3: Decide if you want your project to be the same measurement as the original pattern or a custom measurement.
Hint: If you\'re not sure, use the \'Not Sure\' button and answer a couple of questions, and the app will tell you what the finished measurement of the original pattern will be so you can decide.
Example 1: for casting on

The pattern is asking you to cast on 150 stitches for the neckline. Type \'150\' in the box and click \'next\'. The app will tell you what the neckline of the original pattern measures. You can now use a measuring tape to see if you want your neckline to be the same as that or another measurement.
Example 4: for lengths

The pattern has a total of 76 rows. Type \'76\' in the box and click \'next\'. The app will tell you what the length of the original pattern is. You can now use a measuring tape to see if you want your project to be the same length or another measurement.
STEP 4: Tell the app if any special conditions exist for your pattern.
Example 1: for a multiple plus pattern
Your pattern specifies that the number of stitches cast on must be a multiple of 8 plus 2. You click the option and enter:
Example 2: for a multiple minus pattern
Your pattern specifies that the number of stitches cast on must be a multiple of 9 minus 3. You click the option and enter:
Hint: You can leave the plus and minus boxes empty, you don\'t need to enter a zero if they don\'t apply.
STEP 4: Choose whether you\'re calculating for stitches (width) or rows (length).
Hint: If you\'re using the calculator for an increase or a decrease, choose \'stitches (width)\'.
STEP 5: Click on \'CALCULATE\'.
Once you\'ve chosen, enter either your custom measurement or the number of stitches or rows in the original pattern, as appropriate, in the box that appears.
View, Edit, and Delete your projects at any time
Have questions, comments, suggestions?
Contact us, we\'d love to hear from you!
Welcome to Knit Fits!
Stop wasting time and money knitting projects that don\'t fit…use this app to recalculate the number of stitches or rows for you.
Step 1: Create and save a new project
The app will store the pattern\'s knitting gauge and your own knitting gauge to be used over and over until you\'re done the project.
Step 2: Use the calculator
Use it often: for cast on, for increases and decreases, for the length of your project…anytime you need to verify the fit.
Step 3: Edit or delete projects at any time
Create as many projects as you want, there\'s no limit!
More detailed instructions available
Check out the help section if you need more information.

Skip intro
Next
Hint: New projects will appear at the top of the list.
To View a project\'s gauge details: Click on the pencil icon next to the project\'s name in \'My Projects\'
To Edit a project\'s gauge details: Click on the pencil icon next to the project\'s name in \'My Projects\', make the desired changes, and click \'Save\'
To Delete a project: Click on the trash can icon next to the project\'s name in \'My Projects\'

www.gotchasomething.ca
STEP 2: Choose the calculation that you need the app to perform
Example 2: for an increase or decrease
The pattern is asking you to increase a row by 8 stitches. Enter 8 in the box and click \'calculate\'.
Example 3: for a particular row

The pattern is made to fit someone with a bust of 36 inches and has 120 stitches in the row that is at bust level. Your bust measures 37 inches. Type \'120\' in the box and click \'next\'. Choose \'a different measurement\' and type \'37\' in the box and click \'next\'.
